page.title: 10'West Beer'
page.content: 'West Beer' is a farm with 4 holiday cottages. This week one is empty, it is called 'Acorn' because it is built under an oak tree. There are 3 people who live in the main farmhouse, they are Phillipa and Dick Reynolds and his mother, Mrs Reynolds. They keep 9 milking goats and sell the milk and cheese locally. They also have 6 goat-kids and 3 lambs. They have a dumper truck which they use for transport. There is a playing field for the holiday makers and a large pond containing common carp and rainbow carp. While our house was being rebuilt at 'West Down Farm' we lived at one of the cottages for the winter. I love to go back there now and help Dick around the farm. By Richard Gould, age 10
